condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Boys and girls, adolescents and women on the move and in host communities equitably access essential health services with sustained coverage of high-impact preventive and curative interventions

description.narrative: In 2019, UNICEF assisted 12,172 migrant pregnant women, children and adolescents with health care. More than 3,000 boys and girls living in shelters had access to the minimum set of vaccines recommended in Brazil. A total of 3.352 boys and girls under 5 and 2.991 boys and girls from 5 to 18 years old had access to primary healthcare, including the prevention of diseases, health promotion, diagnostic, treatment, referral and monitoring of diseases. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:06/02/2020

title.narrative: # of boys and girls under five accessing at least the minimum set of vaccines according to the country standards
